comments.body: Under Python 2.6, for input "1,2345" under "fi_FI.UTF-8" locale, PyOS_ascii_strtod refuses to parse the string at all, and returns an error instead of "1" which was the correct best-efforts result.
If this was not clear from the comment below, it perhaps should be updated.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +468,472 @@     * where this would matter is if the decimal separator were
     * something that could occur in the middle of a valid number,
     * in which case this function does the wrong thing.
     */
